website_summaries.verdict: An acceptable choice if your budget is your top priority and you don't have an abundance of crabgrass to kill.
pros: A concentrated crabgrass/weed killer that falls on the low end of the pricing spectrum
Few reports of killing unintended plants
cons: May take 10 days or longer to work
Some treated crabgrass may keep growing

customer_reviews.title: I hate Grabgrass.
customer_reviews.text: I hate Grabgrass.. We have southern lawn that is a centipede on sand. there are crabgrass here and there and I hate it. I bought this and used it. It does not take much for this to work. and I say that because if you use too much you will turn your entire lawn brown. NOT GOOD. IT took over 3 weeks for the crabgrass to die off, but it did in those spots and i will use it again in the other spots. I didnt spray it all over the lawn because I wanted to test it first. If you found this review helpful, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: JR Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Green Light really works!
customer_reviews.text: Over the past several years I have used a couple of different products purchased from our big box home improvement stores to fight crabgrass but have only had bad results. So I tried Green Light last year and was very pleased with how effective it was with just the first application. I do two applications about a week apart and it totally knocks out the mid to late summer crabgrass. I have found that putting a little dish soap, like Dawn, in my pressure sprayer with the herbicide makes a big difference. The soap acts as a surfactant that allows the herbicide to better absorb into the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: TLD

customer_reviews.title: Works great on northern lawns.
customer_reviews.text: Mixed properly into a 1 gallon sprayer, I found this killed a lot of the crabgrass I targeted. Keep your expectations in check - fully grown mid-summer crabgrass will not die off of one application alone. Cutting the target areas really low will help. I applied this liberally to crabgrass after a fresh mowing and noticed a good 80% of the spray areas were starting to die after a day or two. The best part about of this product is that is doesn't kill the grass along with it. I'm glad I took a chance of this product and the product should last a while at 3oz. per application. For the record I have a northern lawn, mostly fescue.
customer_reviews.author: Ionlybuydeals

customer_reviews.title: worked well for killing a lot of crab grass in my yard.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! You have to use a lot so I recommend mixing in a pump sprayer and applying directly at the base of the crabgrass instead of using a water hose sprayer which will thin out the product. I knocked out most of the crabgrass in my backyard using this method. Going to buy a second bottle to finish these suckers off this fall and hopefully be free of crabgrass next year from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Highly Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: My mothers lawn is always infested with crabgrass The experts said it can't be killed in summer I went easy the first time The half/low dosage recommended It killed a lot of it and it stopped it from spreading I went full next time It was fairly hot too in the low 80s It did very well and killed a lot Take your time and it will do the job without killing your grass. It needs at least one more treatment then I need to keep up on it because the neighbors don't but I really like the stuff It also killed the other weeds but I was really after the crabgrass
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews unless something works really well or does not work at all. In this case, this product is trash. I would guess dye and water. Quinclorac Is extremely effective at killing crabgrass and I have used various products over the years, even with much lower concentrates than what this product claims, and they all have done the job. I did four stronger than recommend applications of this product spaced out every week and a half and it literally had zero effect. My best guess is this product is dye and water. The one thing I can assure though is this product does not contain a drop of Quinclorac in it. Complete scam.
customer_reviews.author: MXS8106

customer_reviews.title: killed most not all of the crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: First I tried the Ortho Weed B Gone and it made some of the crabgrass a bit brown but did not kill it. I bought the Green Light Wipe-out product and it killed about 75% of the crabgrass, completely after 1 application. I put a 2nd application on the remaining live crabgrass and it killed about half of it. It killed most other weeds I sprayed too. I would buy it again but hopefully I won't have any next year.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Vandeventer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff Works
customer_reviews.text: Due to a deadly combination of laziness and stupidness, I had a heavy amount of mature crab grass. I tempered my expectations after reading some reviews and hoped to just contain the issue and kill the small stuff. But to my surprise, this stuff killed most of everything, even in the dead of summer. I was hoping it would kill more of the non crab grass weeds, but that's not why I bought it. So, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: triple

customer_reviews.title: Followed instructions but product damaged grass and did not touch ...
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions but product damaged grass and did not touch crabgrass. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on the basf product. I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My crab grass is turning brown. Yah!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave my crab grass two sprayings of the diluted solution two weeds apart as the directions suggested. Much after the first spraying, I noticed that the blades of grass had purple spots. After the second spraying, the crab grass is turning brown and the regular grass seems to be unharmed. I was really hoping for this to happen and it did. I am only giving the Wipe-Out Crabgrass Killer four stars since the crabgrass is brown but not completely dead yet. I hope I have killed it. Looks promising though.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Steele

customer_reviews.title: After a couple applications it has all but eradicated the ...
customer_reviews.text: After a couple applications it has all but eradicated the crabgrass in my southern lawn. The bigger older plants don't seem to mind it though until I mixed a concentrated dose and discriminately applied it every 3 days or so.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works great. Most of the Crabgrass I took care of ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great. Most of the Crabgrass I took care of early spring with a pre-emergent, but there were some spots that were usually not troublesome, so I did not use it there. Sure enough, I have crabgrass in these locations. I have used this on a few spots on my lawn and I was not disappointed. I used a half ounce of dish soap (or non ionic surfactant) per gallon of mixed up spray to aid performance. This also worked well on clover and creeping charlie on my lawn. Will buy again as needed!
customer_reviews.author: lbs360

customer_reviews.title: Not so much
customer_reviews.text: Kinda works, but not really that well. Used directions on the mix. Adding MSO helped a little I think, but overall it’s not worth it. Just spring for the real stuff (QC 75DF) and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark - Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Killed everything but the crab grass. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: FINALY a product that KILLS crabgrass!
customer_reviews.text: After years of box store products to kill crabgrass with no success, GREEN LIGHT was FANTASTIC. Followed directions. with in days all crabgrass was turning brown without and damage to Sahara and zoyzia grasses.
customer_reviews.author: Alii IQ

customer_reviews.title: Far too dilute.  5oz per gallon is too much product.
customer_reviews.text: Far too diluted. You have to use 5oz per gallon, which is double the amount, which, requires you to purchase twice as much and that's if it work at all.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Crab Grass Control
customer_reviews.text: Although this is best product, that I have found for crab grass, you have to increase label amount to a point close to damaging lawn to have any chance of killing crab grass, other products with crab grass control on label are a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: chuck scribner

customer_reviews.title: Crabgrasses best friend
customer_reviews.text: Three applications and the score is 3 - 0 crabgrass. For this to work substitute gasoline in place of dishwashing soap. Will keep you posted
customer_reviews.author: P. Damiens

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with another product to try and kill the crab grass I had growing in my yard. It seemed to be working a couple days afterwards but within a week I had more crabgrass in my lawn. If you're buying this to get rid of crabgrass look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bluegrass Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It worked on sprouted crabgrass.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for the crabgrass in the lawn after it became.a.problem. I didn't get the preemergent down at the right time, so I used this in my Bermuda grass. It worked well with two treatments.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: very strong, be careful
customer_reviews.text: I mixed 2 oz per gal as instructions say for a sprayer, and I killed much of the good grass as well as the crabgrass. I did apply a bit more than a quick spray, so it may have been my fault. Be careful and go easy, because its way stronger than anything I used before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: While this product does kill weeds, in contrast to ...
customer_reviews.text: While this product does kill weeds, in contrast to the lengthy disclaimer contained on the bottle --- it appears to also kill Bermuda grass as opposed to merely discoloring the grass. I followed the directions precisely.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Texas

customer_reviews.title: I Hate Crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: It not only wiped out crabgrass, it burned our the good grass also. I'm not alarmed . . . it'll come back. Rather than do a broadcast spray, I spot sprayed patches.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crabgrass Killer that works
customer_reviews.text: After using other crabgrass killers, which did not work, I was happy that I bought this product when it worked as advertised. I sprayed the crabgrass once and it was dead within a few days. I would recommend this product to anyone who wants a truly good crabgrass eliminator.
customer_reviews.author: James F Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I've followed the directions and applied it three times. If it's possible, the crabgrass has actually gotten greener and more healthly. This definitely did NOT harm the crabgrass or hinder its growth in any way.
customer_reviews.author: cakedog02

customer_reviews.text: green light wipe out crabgrass killer apply to my rear area of my lawn kill many weeds no lawn damage this product works very well used 1gallon pump sprayer easy to use like very much would buy again jerry penna.
customer_reviews.author: the beav,

customer_reviews.title: Great for Centipede lawn
customer_reviews.text: Had major crabgrass choking out my newly plugged centipede lawn. This stuff worked great and didn't harm the centipede at all. Kills spurge, clover and lots of other nasty weeds. Just need it to be available for next summer!
customer_reviews.author: dearp

customer_reviews.title: Works good ..
customer_reviews.text: Works for most weeds , even crabgrass in my bermuda grass , it may take a couple applications , dont mix strong it'll kill bermuda grass
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 bottles and sprayed twice and didn't do a think to the crabgrass.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Killed off some grass during a drought, but I put lots of chemicals down. This stuff took out pretty much only crab grass in DAYS. without significant harm to my yard. Neighbor applied some an hour before rain and it still worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: it killed all my grass but weeds are coming back
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't very happy with the results. I had another one before (another brand) and it worked really good. But this one - No! Will not buy it again and will not recommend to anyone.

customer_reviews.title: Crabgrass Killer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I never knew you could kill crabgrass once it starts growing. I mix this up at 5 oz. per gallon of water and spray on the crabgrass. In a couple days the crabgrass starts to turn yellow and die. It also kills a bunch of different weeds. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Terry J.

customer_reviews.title: Works well against crabgrass.
customer_reviews.text: There are dead crabgrass shoots all over my yard. it works well. Just give it a few days Please be careful with it as it is poison..
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Millman, CPA

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Works well when used as directed. I use it for spot spray on crabgrass, but it also kills many many weed varieties. Won't harm Fescue grass, just don't use too high a concentration and do it in early spring when cool. Have re-ordered several times.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing to the Crabgrass........
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions on my first purchase of this product and waited3 weeks and it did nothing to the crabgrass second purchase made the mix stronger and applied 2 weeks later still green grab grass. The lawn was not watered during this trial. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: H.W.

customer_reviews.title: Apply before ground temperature reaches 55 degrees F
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is GREAT! I almost did not buy it due t the reviews. However; with some research. I found that crabgrass is a cold weather annual. Meaning this product needs tp be applied BEFORE ground temperature raise above 50-55 degrees F. I will definitely be using in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Green Lifht Crabgrass killer is an effective remedy for crabgrass ...
customer_reviews.text: Green Lifht Crabgrass killer is an effective remedy for crabgrass infestation of your lawn. I've noticed its effect within 24hours, but as with every product I've used for this problem it takes several applications for maximum effectiveness. Even so the price I've paid for the amount of product I bought on Amazon has not been matched by any other retailer, so I'm giving this purchase a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: mrcamino

customer_reviews.title: crabgrass killer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mix and use , but still waiting for results. Can't make further assessment at this time.

customer_reviews.title: Kills Crabgrass!
customer_reviews.text: Killed Long Island , NY fully grown crabgrass at the end of August. Did 2nd application about 2 weeks later.

customer_reviews.title: The weather has been hot and dry since my first ...
customer_reviews.text: The weather has been hot and dry since my first application. Its been 4 days and the crabgrass is still thriving. It did kill some other weeds but not crabgrass.. I applied a second application recently time will tell but not looking good

customer_reviews.title: Kills crabgrass as advertised

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My yard is the only one on my bock that doesn't have crabgrass. This stuff works.

customer_reviews.title: The Crabgrass worked exactly as it said it would.

customer_reviews.title: The product works good on Crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: The product works good on Crabgrass. However, I had to apply it twice before it killed the crabgrass. I used the mixture that was stated in the instructions.

customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that Green Light Crabgrass Killer would not be as effective now that it does contain MSMA. I was pleased with the results I had on patches of Crabgrass after two applications. The Crabgrass was completely dead and there was no damage to the common Bermuda grass.

customer_reviews.title: Okay....

customer_reviews.title: Very good kill on some very TOUGH crabgrass
customer_reviews.text: I am fighting crabgrass that has been undisturbed for 3-4 years. This product did a much better job than Bayer's equivalent. I did not compare in any scientific way, but the overall kill seems to be much better when all things are considered.

customer_reviews.text: Crabgrass in my front yard said it wanted more of this stuff. sprayed them on Thursday and 10 days later the grass seem even bigger and stronger

customer_reviews.title: Am so glad to be able to obtain this product through Amazon ...

customer_reviews.title: Death to Crab Grass!
customer_reviews.text: Product does what it clais, i.e. kills crabgrass dead. The first application killed about 80% of the grasses, and the second (light) application killed the rest. I love the product.

customer_reviews.title: not really killing my crab grass. def killing the ...
customer_reviews.text: not really killing my crab grass. def killing the grass around it. some weaker or younger ones will dye after 2-3 uses.

customer_reviews.title: Crabgrass alive, turf grass dead
customer_reviews.text: The crabgrass in my lawn is thriving since this product wiped out the competition.

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome I made the mix a little stronger than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome I made the mix a little stronger than the label, it took about a week to see the results

customer_reviews.title: ... of application the product seems to be doing some good. I mixed 3oz per gallon and broad sprayed ...
customer_reviews.text: After one week of application the product seems to be doing some good. I mixed 3oz per gallon and broad sprayed this lawn. The lawn had about 25% crabgrass growing at the time. The next application will be done tomorrow and I plan to bump up the dosage to 4oz per gallon. Further updates yet to come. This lawn is located in Charlotte, NC.

customer_reviews.title: tried a new fertilizer to PREVENT crabgrass that DID NOT ...

customer_reviews.text: Product killed the crabgrass as I wanted it to. Had to apply twice due to it raining once but used a little more than 2 oz and it did the job.

customer_reviews.title: but there is nothing like prevention with a pre-emergent
customer_reviews.text: This product hast o be used early on in the life of the crabgrass, when there are 2 or less leaves, otherwise this will just stunt the growth, and if you are lucky, it will prevent the plant going to seed. All n all, it does hurt it, but there is nothing like prevention with a pre-emergent.

customer_reviews.title: It works

customer_reviews.title: Makes Broadleaf Weeds Sick and Crabgrass Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I first tried it at the recommended dilution and sprayed all my broadleaf weeds and most of my crabgrass. It made some of the broadleaf weeds sick, but the crabgrass simply said, "I'd like some more please." After two weeks I mixed it at double the concentration of what the directions called for. It killed the broadleaf weeds but the crabgrass is still asking for more. I usually use another brand of lawn weed killer. I found this stuff to be less effective than it. The only thing that I've found that kills crabgrass kills everything.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: i wated a grabgrass killer for this timr of the ...

customer_reviews.title: I applied as instructions said but so far nothing much ...
customer_reviews.text: I applied as instructions said but so far nothing much has happened, it's been a couple of weeks I think it should be working by now. If you have any suggestions please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bonham

customer_reviews.title: Patience!!  After five days I noticed an absence of weeds and weedy grasses.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to identify crab grass so I don't know whether or not I have any. I do have many hot-weather weedy coarse-bladed grasses and other broadleaf weeds. They all grow fast and deprive the fine-bladed Bermuda grass of sunlight. It took about five days for this product to kill off the weeds/grasses I had sprayed. During that time, the Bermuda had begun to grow again but it also gave new weeds time to grow. Periodic re-treatment is necessary to keep down the new weed growth until the Bermuda has a chance to thicken up again. I would give 5 stars if it worked as well as MSMA but that is history, what can you do.
customer_reviews.author: L. Evatt

customer_reviews.title: ... dry season when crabgrass thrives but so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for the hot dry season when crabgrass thrives but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: John A Gartner

customer_reviews.title: After 3 applications mixed according to directions, I still ...
customer_reviews.text: After 3 applications mixed according to directions, I still have healthy prospering weeds in my lawn. Wish I could get my money back

customer_reviews.title: works better than the company I hired to fertilize and weed ...
customer_reviews.text: works better than the company I hired to fertilize and weed kill. I tried the company for a year and they kept saying the weeds will die off, but never did. So I bought this and it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do, goes a long way & great price
customer_reviews.text: 2 ozs per gallon goes a long way & it covers 400 sq. ft. If you follow directions it will ONLY kill the weeds & crabgrass and NOT hurt tall fescue. The price is GREAT for 1 qt.

customer_reviews.title: It has stuned its growth but it has not killed ...
customer_reviews.text: It has stuned its growth but it has not killed. It also has not killed the other weeds in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: but this stuff killed my crabgrass like you wouldn't believe
customer_reviews.text: Took two applications, but this stuff killed my crabgrass like you wouldn't believe.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Did my research and this one has 2, 4D (weed killer) at 7.3% and quinclorac (crabgrass killer) at 3.5%. Higher percentage than other name brands and cheaper. I had lots of weeds including crabgrass in my backyard - emerald zoysia. Mixed as directed and sprayed with a tank sprayer, one week later I'm almost completely weed free. Very pleased with results. There aren't that many different weed killers available, most are strength variations of these two chemicals. I suspect negative reviews are those who didn't follow directions exactly. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Turned the crabgrass a little purple but does not kill it. Also won't kill spotted spurge. Killed a few dandelions, otherwise worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: wee killer
customer_reviews.text: If you need to Wipe-Out Crabgrass this is your product.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Beaty

product_meta.title: GREEN LIGHT 7462 Wipe-Out Crabgrass Killer PLUS Concentrate - 1-Quart
product_meta.description: Wipe out crabgrass killer plus active ingredients include 2,4-d, dimehtylamine slat, quinclorac and dicamba. The toughest formula ever on crabgrass. Kills more than 250 weeds, roots and all. Kills tough broadleaf and troublesome grass weeds including dandelion, chickweed, clover and foxtail. Lawn friendly formula kills the weeds not the lawn and starts working on contact. 32 ounces covers 6,400 square feet area.
feature_bullets: Active ingredients include 2,4-d, dimehtylamine salt, quinclorac and dicamba
